page.title: 16 A Poultry Farm
page.content: King Rudding Farm on the edge of Skipwith Common has 84,000 chickens, kept in rearing cages from a day old to 16 weeks. The farm is part of the Blackwood Hall organisation which has a rearing farm and 3 laying farms. Altogether 55 people are employed. Their other farms are at Breighton, Skipwith and Blackwood Hall itself. King Rudding Farm has been operating for 16 years. Chicken feed is delivered from B.O.C.M. A farm worker said he worked 7 days a week, as he had to feed the chickens every day. He starts at 8am and finishes at 5pm, although the hours vary at the weekend. Another poultry worker said that he collects eggs from 8,880 chickens-from just 1 battery. He collects roughly 450 dozen eggs from one battery.
